alert.note: Alert for Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Middlesex; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 8:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Gloucester, southwestern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, Charles City, New Kent, southeastern Henrico, southeastern King William and northern James City Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 858 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from King William to near Tunstall to near Jordans Point. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... King William around 905 PM EDT. New Kent, King And Queen Court House and Providence Forge around 910 PM EDT. Ruthville and Little Plymouth around 915 PM EDT. West Point, Holdcroft, Church View, Rustic and Barhamsville around 920 PM EDT. Shacklefords around 925 PM EDT. Urbanna, Norge, Toano and Saluda around 930 PM EDT. Glenns around 935 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Eltham, Chickahominy Shore, Croaker, Wayside, Mountcastle, Elko, Cohoke, Dragonville, Glendale and Lanexa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Henrico; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Middlesex; New Kent
